intro: Pleuromanes album, commonly known as the white pleuromanes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
